Reviews.Title: “Condo #403 is fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: slyle71
Reviews.Content: This condo is VRBO listing #268470. Let me just say that this is the best condo we have ever rented. We arrived around 3:30pm and cleaning crew was still here. Both ladies were so nice and finished up quickly. They were knowledgable about local grocery stores and restaraunts. The pictures of this condo are completely accurate. The condo overlooks the pool and the hottub area and has a perfect view of the beach. Sunglow Pier is right next door for fishing and also has Crabby Joe's restaraunt. One elevator was broken during the weekend but was fixed promptly on Monday morning. Front desk staff is nice and helpful. All hallways/common areas were clean, pool and spa was sparkling. All furniture in the condo was clean and in perfect condition Recliner in the living room is fabulous!! My kids loved their room with the two beds and flat screen TV. Kitchen was well equipped with all that we needed. One of the best parts of this condo was that they provided starter tissues, soap, dish soap and paper towels. Most condos do not do that!! There was even coffee available although we brought our own. There were also boogie boards, highchair, playpen, water noodles and beach pails in the hallway closet!!! All in all, I give this condo an excellent rating. The owners were great to work with and always answered my emails promptly.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very nice time in the unit we rented”
Reviews.Author: JohnT1492
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying we were looking for an affordable week-long rental in the Daytona area. As someone else said, there are about 900,000 units to rent in the area, so finding one that's nice, but affordable can be a daunting challenge. We happened to find one. Also, know that each unit is individually owned, so the condition of each individual unit will vary. We rented unit 402. A quick rundown: the A/C worked fine. The entire unit was tiled, so there was no carpet to worry about. The furnishings were nothing special, but they were all functional and nothing was broken or worn out. The kitchen appliances were functional and modern. The bathrooms were both fine. The decor was fine, if nothing special. So, as far as this specific unit, I have no complaints (except perhaps I would have appreciated a ceiling fan in the master bedroom, but that's just me being finicky). There were three TVs with cable, two CRTs (in the bedrooms) and one HDTV in the living room. Is this a luxury building? No. Is it a luxury price? Again, no. This was an affordable, but clean condo. So, what about the building and grounds? First, the pool/hot tub/deck area was very nice. We had a unit overlooking the pool area and beach, so we saw the maintenance man meticulously cleaning and rearranging the deck area every morning. The whole area was clean and inviting. We visited for Memorial day weekend and the whole following week in 2012. They had just repaved the parking lot, and worked on the staircase to the beach, but, that was completed before we left, so no issues there. We had NO problems with parking. Although some people had issues with elevators, when we were there, both elevators were working just fine for the entire week. The staff that we interacted with were friendly and accommodating. The building is a little older, but it's been maintained fairly well. Again, it's not luxury by any means, but the price more than makes up for it. There are coin laundry facilities on site. I wish they had a recycling program at the building, but they don't (although you can drop your recycling into bins on the beach if you like). As far as bugs, as others mentioned, we had no problems. We had no issues with fleas or roaches. We did have a few flies and other small flying insects, but that's just because this unit had no screens and we had left the sliding doors wide open to take advantage of the breezes. All in all, my family of four had a terrific vacation at Sunglow. As I mentioned, with each unit being individually owned, I can't really speak to the other units, but if you're looking for a nice unit at a great price, I would recommend unit 402.

Reviews.Title: “Great views just have to get past the dirty”
Reviews.Author: Robbyn C
Reviews.Content: Wonderful views of the beach. Unfortunately the condo was very very dirty. Found dirty dishes and towels in the cabinets, pull out bed HAD NO MATTRESS, every door in the place would not close or lock, no window curtains, blinds, shades on the bedrooms. Furnishings were all very dated and not working. All in all not a place I would recommend. Like I said, the view is fantastic, but would of been better off staying in an updated hotel or resort. Condo looked NOTHING like the pictures online at sunglowresorts.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusKris
Reviews.Content: My family had a wonderful time @ Sunglow Resort!! I've read that some of the units may not be as nice as some of the others but we stayed in a tropical beach paradise & I don't have a single complaint. It has been beautifully redone and has the most comfy furniture. Not to mention the balcony overlooking the ocean - couldn't ask for a better view! The resort itself may be showing it's age but it's very safe (the doors lock @ a certain time & you need a key to enter), the staff were nice & helpful, and it's in a great location. We enjoyed the pool area, the water is a perfect temperature - not too warm or too cold. We stayed a week & never heard our 'neighbors' while we were in the condo. Yes, the parking situation was a pain but that's not Sunglow's fault, the county is putting in drain pipes. We always got lucky and found a spot in the lot across the street , thankfully. Sunglow was very apologetic about the hassle but there's not much they could do. At least it's temporary, should be done soon. All in all, I'd recommend Sunglow Resort...just be sure to research your condo rental & look at the pictures. I miss our beach getaway already!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your vacation time or your money!!”
Reviews.Author: tksings
Reviews.Content: My husband and I rented a 2 bedroom/2 bath condo on the 10th floor. The place is totally dated (with VHS) and needs a complete re-do. I am going to download some pictures to show the vents in the bathroom, the only closet to hang clothes in has a disgusting air conditioner and stuff hanging off it and a place that would only be good for beach-goers with kids (all tile floors). Not a good place for Valentine's Day weekend. The only reason I gave it one star is for the view.

Reviews.Title: “SPRING BREAK 2011”
Reviews.Author: mike v
Reviews.Content: Sunglow is a great place to stay for a few days or a week. I was there with my kids for spring break and we had a great time, eventhough it rained all day one of the days. We were on the 5th floor. The room was clean and comfortable, bed was nice and the bathroom was old, but clean. Plenty of towels too. All appliances worked and no bugs or other Florida critters. It was just great leaving the balcony door open and listen to the surf for hours. The balcony was great. Great view too. The pool was clean and warm and so was the hot tub. The ocean is just a few steps away and the sand was warm but the ocean was cold. It was the end of March. We have stayed here many times and never had any problems. Lisa, who made our reservations, was great. Just a great week, book it though Lisa and you will be glad you did. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Time Or Money...”
Reviews.Author: Blac123
Reviews.Content: I visited the Sunglow Resort in June 2011. I had a lot of worries after reading through some of the reviews I had found regarding this resort. Against my better judgement, I decided to go ahead and book unit 207, vrbo listing #891. When we first arrived, we had to drive past the resort and turn around to get to it since there was construction going on the entire time of our stay, which woke us up most mornings. When we walked in the first thing we noticed ( a group of 7 ) was the overwhelming odor of pesticide throughout the building. When we got up to our floor we noticed the door wasn't properly sealed on unit 207- I was already worried. We walked in and the first thing I noticed was the dirtiness of the walls near the bottom. It looked as if the walls hadn't been washed for years. The furniture was old, mix-matched, and dirty. The kitchen table was so wobbly we couldn't use it to eat any meals. I slept in the second bedroom and the bed hurt my back so bad (I am in my 20's), we had to take the mattress off the frame so I could sleep on the floor! That's when we saw that the frame was broken and laying on the floor, no wonder! We had bought some groceries for our stay and had snacks, bread, and fruit on the counter, and after about three days some people in our party informed me of roaches. I was disgusted and didn't want to believe it, but the next day I woke up and there they were. I wanted to leave right then but a member of our group had their family with them and we didn't want to ruin their vacation, especially since they hadn't been on vacation in ten years. The master bedroom ceiling was cracked and looked a little wet. The staff was semi-friendly (nothing too over the top), they definitely weren't the most welcoming staff we've had experience with. I was so worried that the bathrooms were going to be the worst part and they turned out to be the best part of the entire condo. The pictures on the vrbo website certainly do not accurately depict the way it really looks, even though we sent an email to the woman who owns the condo asking her if the pictures were accurate. When we left, we called to tell her what we experienced and explained that we didn't call because we all were very determined to make the best of the situation, and she seemed concerned and said she'd make some phone calls. She never returned our call so we called back and she said the best she could do was to give us a 200 dollar gift certificate to stay there next year- as if we'd ever want to experience that again!! When asked If we could have at least our 100 dollar deposit, she couldn't even do that. She was more concerned with business than she was with customer service. She can count on us never having any dealings with her again. Her contracts are extremely wordy and confusing. If you want the best value for your money, I'd wholeheartedly suggest finding another place.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: dowopjoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunglow the month of September. It is on the quiet end of Daytona Beach Shores. Our unit was clean with a king size bed over looking the pool, and beach. Close to many restaurants and Ponce Inlet.We have vacationed in Daytona Beach for 25 years,and e like the Sun Glow the best. You can find other places cheaper,but you get what you pay for. Can't wait untill next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fine family vacation”
Reviews.Author: hreinig28
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my family and I greatly enjoy staying at this resort. Our first family vacation we stayed in Pat's place and had such a wonderful experience. The owner is one of the nicest I have ever had the pleasure of dealing with and even recommended a stay to family. We did decide to stay again in June of 2009 but stayed in condo 306 and once again a wonderful experience with only a few problems that the owner was very willing to take of. The resort is a little older but I can tell you it is well maintained and the staff overwhelmingly helpful. We have just reserved our stay for June of 2010 and my mom is planning her vacation at the same time. I look forward to spending our family vacation there again this year. If you desire a home away from home with wonderful staff, beautiful beach and view at an affordable price....Look no where else.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise @ the Sunglow”
Reviews.Author: RBHebert
Reviews.Content: The Sunglow Condos in Daytona Beach Fla. was the alternative to paying the high price for a ocean view Hotel room, because this was just like staying @ home, because everything was supplied to us, including the linens, and towels not like most condos you have to bring your own. Located right on Daytona Beach, beautiful white, cool fine sand too. Also just a short walk from the condo to "Crabby Joes" fishing pier, where you can eat and do a little shopping too.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: relaxationers
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews I felt compelled to right my review. My husband and I decided to spend three days at Daytona Beach before heading to the bahamas. We were not too sure what to expect because we didn't spend a ton of money to stay here. We were pleasantly surprised. The condo's were old but pretty clean. Our bedding was the only real issue we had. The sheets and sand in them. We had to change our own bedding. We really can't complain. We met some of the owners and they were lots of fun to hang out with. They know the area well and suggested some great places to eat. Our recommendation would be that you try to rent directly from an owner so that you can talk to them directly about thier unit. The beach was beautiful. The pool was nice but was shady in the later afternoon. All in all, we would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: kenwwright
Reviews.Content: I searched the web for two days before I found and booked my stay at the Sunglow. After I reserved and payed I decided to check the reviews. Needless to say I was a bit nervous after reading some. When I arrived it was after hours. My keys were right where they said they would be. I walked it to my condo and was instantly relieved. It was clean, smelled nice, and the view is second to none. It is located on the south end, its actually Daytona Shores. So it is a bit more quiet yet still close to anything you would want to do. Some of the places I enjoyed are Ya Ya,s, They have a very friendly staff and good prices. The Main street pier has a great Tiki bar with a view from the pier. Stay away from Portofino's. If you have ever been to one this particular one will be more than disappointing. I want to mention I stayed in two different condos at the Sunglow. Both were above average and I will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “FLEAS”
Reviews.Author: You4
Reviews.Content: The building is older and needs some updating but I am told that some individual condos are quite nice. Unfortunately not the one we rented for a week. You sure can't tell a book by it's cover. The pictures and description on the website sure did not tell the real story. The condo was dirty. The carpets were disgustingly dirty. The furniture was old and falling apart. The pots, pans, plates, glasses, cutlery, etc looked like the leftover items from a garage sale that didn't sell. The showers were dirty and rusty. But the worst was the place was full of fleas. The owners then tried to blame us for bringing them in when we asked for a refund. Beware of renting from this woman in Ohio. This is a business to her and she only wants your money. She doesn't know the meaning of nor cares about customer satisfaction. She was right down rude and nasty. She ruined our family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: goldentoronto
Reviews.Content: This place is the pits. It is old and needs some upkeep. The condo we stayed in looked like everything was original from when the place may have been new some 40 years ago I would guess. The carpet was stained and dirty. The showers had rust all around the doors. Only 1 of the 2 elevators was working and we were told it has been like that for years. To top it all off, the condo was full of fleas and they tried to blame us. This was a terrible experience and I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. It seems others have had similar experiences here and blamed for everything. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Missed this year trying to do better.!!”
Reviews.Author: pddally
Reviews.Content: We booked the the sunglow in 2006 and were very happy with our stay. We had two Families;mine and our daughters,so we got a two bedroom unit. the rooms were very spacious,clean and well kept. This place is an older place with old elevators,but at least one was working allways. Shores is a quieter atmosphere than up towards daytona. we found a lots to do down at the pier(and under it finding crabs) I will try to get the same rooms this year,should have in 2007. price is right!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Julie_Marie3420
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending five nights at the Sunglow Resort next to Sunglow Pier in Daytona Beach Shores. Our family had plenty of room in a two bedroom two bath condo facing the ocean. The location is great. We enjoyed eating at the pier restaurant and nearby restaurants. My husband did some fishing. Our children spent a lot of time in the pool and walking on the beach. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful when we had questions. We're planning to return to enjoy the Sunglow next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and roomy”
Reviews.Author: 68goat
Reviews.Content: Nice and roomy two bedroom / two bath unit that was a direct ocean front unit. As we understand it, all units are individually owned and our unit was extremely well maintained, clean and comfortable to be in. Overall the sunglow building had all the convenience we were looking for, a heated pool with jacuzzi along with being located next to the Sunglow pier made it a great place to have a drink and dinner or lunch without walking very far. Location is ideal because it is away from the crazy downtown area but convenient enough to shopping and many local restaurants. Parking is somewhat tight around the building, but they offer additional parking across the street at an additional property owned parking lot, which allowed us to conveniently park our motorcycle trailer. I will use this condo again for future rental.

HotelInfo.Name: Sunglow Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 3647 South Atlantic Ave., Daytona Beach, FL 32118
